KJVverseText: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.

IVverseText: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
KJVverseText: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.

IVverseText: God hath delivered me to the ungodly and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
KJVverseText: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.

IVverseText: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder; he hath also taken me by the neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
KJVverseText: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

IVverseText: His archers compass me round about; he cleaveth my reins asunder and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
KJVverseText: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.

IVverseText: He breaketh me with breach upon breach; he runneth upon me like a giant.
KJVverseText: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.

IVverseText: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin and defiled my horn in the dust.
KJVverseText: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.

IVverseText: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death,
KJVverseText: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

IVverseText: Not for any injustice in mine hands; also, my prayer is pure.
KJVverseText: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.

IVverseText: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
KJVverseText: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.

IVverseText: Also, now behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.
KJVverseText: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.

IVverseText: My friends scorn me; but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
KJVverseText: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.

IVverseText: Oh, that one might plead for a man with God as a man pleadeth for his neighbor!
KJVverseText: Oh that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbor!

IVverseText: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
KJVverseText: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.

IVverseText: My breath is corrupt; my days are extinct; the graves are ready for me.
KJVverseText: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are ready for me.

IVverseText: Are there not mockers with me? And doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?
KJVverseText: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?

IVverseText: Lay down now; put me in a surety with thee. Who is he that will strike hands with me?
KJVverseText: Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?

IVverseText: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding; therefore shalt thou not exalt them.
KJVverseText: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.

IVverseText: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.
KJVverseText: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.

IVverseText: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.
KJVverseText: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.

IVverseText: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.
KJVverseText: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.

IVverseText: Upright men shall be astonished at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
KJVverseText: Upright men shall be astonished at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.

IVverseText: The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
KJVverseText: The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.

IVverseText: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now; for I cannot find one wise man among you.
KJVverseText: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find one wise man among you.

IVverseText: My days are past; my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.
KJVverseText: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.

IVverseText: They change the night into day; the light is short because of darkness.
KJVverseText: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.

IVverseText: If I wait, the grave is mine house; I have made my bed in the darkness.
KJVverseText: If I wait, the grave is mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.

IVverseText: I have said to corruption, Thou art my father--to the worm, Thou art my mother and my sister.
KJVverseText: I have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.

IVverseText: And where is now my hope? As for my hope, who shall see it?
KJVverseText: And where is now my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?

IVverseText: They shall go down to the bars of the pit when our rest together is in the dust.
KJVverseText: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.

IVverseText: Then answered Bildad, the Shuhite, and said,
KJVverseText: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

IVverseText: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? Mark, and afterwards we will speak.
KJVverseText: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.

IVverseText: Wherefore are we counted as beasts and reputed vile in your sight?
KJVverseText: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?

IVverseText: He teareth himself in his anger. Shall the earth be forsaken for thee? And shall the rock be removed out of his place?
KJVverseText: He teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?

IVverseText: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
KJVverseText: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.

IVverseText: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.
KJVverseText: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.

IVverseText: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
KJVverseText: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.

IVverseText: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.
KJVverseText: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.

IVverseText: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
KJVverseText: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.

IVverseText: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.
KJVverseText: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.

IVverseText: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side and shall drive him to his feet.
KJVverseText: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.

IVverseText: His strength shall be hunger-bitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
KJVverseText: His strength shall be hunger-bitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.

IVverseText: It shall devour the strength of his skin; even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.
KJVverseText: It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.

IVverseText: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.
KJVverseText: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.

IVverseText: It shall dwell in his tabernacle because it is none of his; brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
KJVverseText: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.

IVverseText: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
KJVverseText: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.

IVverseText: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.
KJVverseText: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.

IVverseText: He shall be driven from light into darkness and chased out of the world.
KJVverseText: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.

IVverseText: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people nor any remaining in his dwellings.
KJVverseText: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.

IVverseText: They that come after him shall be astonished at his day as they that went before were affrighted.
KJVverseText: They that come after him shall be astonished at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.

IVverseText: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
KJVverseText: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.

IVverseText: Then Job answered and said,
KJVverseText: Then Job answered and said,

IVverseText: How long will ye vex my soul and break me in pieces with words?
KJVverseText: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?

IVverseText: These ten times have ye reproached me; ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.
KJVverseText: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.

IVverseText: And be it, indeed, that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.
KJVverseText: And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.

IVverseText: If, indeed, ye will magnify yourselves against me and plead against me my reproach,
KJVverseText: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:

IVverseText: Know now that God hath overthrown me and hath compassed me with his net.
KJVverseText: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.

IVverseText: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard; I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.
KJVverseText: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.

IVverseText: He hath fenced up my way, that I cannot pass; and he hath set darkness in my paths.
KJVverseText: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.

IVverseText: He hath stripped me of my glory and taken the crown from my head.
KJVverseText: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.

IVverseText: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone; and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.
KJVverseText: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.

IVverseText: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
KJVverseText: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.

IVverseText: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.
KJVverseText: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.

IVverseText: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.
KJVverseText: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.

IVverseText: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.
KJVverseText: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.

IVverseText: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger; I am an alien in their sight.
KJVverseText: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.

IVverseText: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I entreated him with my mouth.
KJVverseText: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I entreated him with my mouth.

IVverseText: My breath is strange to my wife, though I entreated for the children's sake of mine own body.
KJVverseText: My breath is strange to my wife, though I entreated for the children's sake of mine own body.

IVverseText: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.
KJVverseText: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.

IVverseText: All my inward friends abhorred me; and they whom I loved are turned against me.
KJVverseText: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.

IVverseText: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
KJVverseText: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.

IVverseText: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye, my friends, for the hand of God hath touched me.
KJVverseText: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.

IVverseText: Why do ye persecute me as God and are not satisfied with my flesh?
KJVverseText: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?

IVverseText: Oh, that my words were now written! Oh, that they were printed in a book!
KJVverseText: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!

IVverseText: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!
KJVverseText: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!

IVverseText: For I know that my Redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth;
KJVverseText: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:

IVverseText: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God,
KJVverseText: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:

IVverseText: Whom I shall see for myself; and mine eyes shall behold, and not another, though my reins be consumed within me.
KJVverseText: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.

IVverseText: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?
KJVverseText: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?

IVverseText: Be ye afraid of the sword; for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.
KJVverseText: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.

IVverseText: Then answered Zophar, the Naamathite, and said,
KJVverseText: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

IVverseText: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.
KJVverseText: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.

IVverseText: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
KJVverseText: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.

IVverseText: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,
KJVverseText: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,

IVverseText: That the triumphing of the wicked is short and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?
KJVverseText: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?

IVverseText: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens and his head reach unto the clouds,
KJVverseText: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;

IVverseText: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung. They which have seen him shall say, Where is he?
KJVverseText: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where is he?

IVverseText: He shall fly away as a dream and shall not be found; yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night;
KJVverseText: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.

IVverseText: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.
KJVverseText: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.

IVverseText: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.
KJVverseText: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.

IVverseText: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.
KJVverseText: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.

IVverseText: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue,
KJVverseText: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue;

IVverseText: Though he spare it and forsake it not, but keep it still within his mouth,
KJVverseText: Though he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:

IVverseText: Yet his meat in his bowels is turned; it is the gall of asps within him.
KJVverseText: Yet his meat in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.

IVverseText: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again; God shall cast them out of his belly.
KJVverseText: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

IVverseText: He shall suck the poison of asps; the viper's tongue shall slay him.
KJVverseText: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper's tongue shall slay him.

IVverseText: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.
KJVverseText: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.

IVverseText: That which he labored for shall he restore and shall not swallow it down; according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.
KJVverseText: That which he labored for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down: according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.

IVverseText: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor, because he hath violently taken away a house which he builded not,
KJVverseText: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor; because he hath violently taken away a house which he builded not;

IVverseText: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly; he shall not save of that which he desired.
KJVverseText: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.

IVverseText: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.
KJVverseText: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.

IVverseText: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits; every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.
KJVverseText: In the fullness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.

IVverseText: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.
KJVverseText: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.

IVverseText: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.
KJVverseText: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.

IVverseText: It is drawn and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall; terrors are upon him.
KJVverseText: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors are upon him.

IVverseText: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places; a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
KJVverseText: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.

IVverseText: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity, and the earth shall rise up against him.
KJVverseText: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.

IVverseText: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
KJVverseText: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

IVverseText: This is the portion of a wicked man from God and the heritage appointed unto him by God.
KJVverseText: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.

IVverseText: But Job answered and said,
KJVverseText: But Job answered and said,

IVverseText: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
KJVverseText: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.

IVverseText: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.
KJVverseText: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.

IVverseText: As for me, is my complaint to man? And if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
KJVverseText: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?

IVverseText: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.
KJVverseText: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.

IVverseText: Even when I remember, I am afraid; and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
KJVverseText: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.

IVverseText: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?
KJVverseText: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?

IVverseText: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
KJVverseText: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.

IVverseText: Their houses are safe from fear; neither is the rod of God upon them.
KJVverseText: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.

IVverseText: Their bull gendereth and faileth not; their cow calveth and casteth not her calf.
KJVverseText: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

IVverseText: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.
KJVverseText: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

IVverseText: They take the timbrel and harp and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
KJVverseText: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.

IVverseText: They spend their days in wealth and in a moment go down to the grave.
KJVverseText: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.

IVverseText: Therefore, they say unto God, Depart from us, for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
KJVverseText: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.

IVverseText: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? And what profit should we have if we pray unto him?
KJVverseText: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?

IVverseText: Lo, their good is not in their hand; the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
KJVverseText: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

IVverseText: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! And how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.
KJVverseText: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.

IVverseText: They are as stubble before the wind and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
KJVverseText: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.

IVverseText: God layeth up his iniquity for his children; he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.
KJVverseText: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.

IVverseText: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
KJVverseText: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

IVverseText: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?
KJVverseText: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?

IVverseText: Shall any teach God knowledge, seeing he judgeth those that are high?
KJVverseText: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.

IVverseText: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.
KJVverseText: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.

IVverseText: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
KJVverseText: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.

IVverseText: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul and never eateth with pleasure.
KJVverseText: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.

IVverseText: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
KJVverseText: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.

IVverseText: Behold, I know your thoughts and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
KJVverseText: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

IVverseText: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? And where are the dwelling places of the wicked?
KJVverseText: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?

IVverseText: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? And do ye not know their tokens,
KJVverseText: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,

IVverseText: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? They shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.
KJVverseText: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.

IVverseText: Who shall declare his way to his face? And who shall repay him what he hath done?
KJVverseText: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?

IVverseText: Yet shall he be brought to the grave and shall remain in the tomb.
KJVverseText: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.

IVverseText: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.
KJVverseText: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.

IVverseText: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood.
KJVverseText: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?

IVverseText: Then Eliphaz, the Temanite, answered and said,
KJVverseText: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

IVverseText: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
KJVverseText: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

IVverseText: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty that thou art righteous? Or is it gain to him that thou makest thy ways perfect?
KJVverseText: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

IVverseText: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? Will he enter with thee into judgment?
KJVverseText: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

IVverseText: Is not thy wickedness great and thine iniquities infinite?
KJVverseText: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

IVverseText: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for naught and stripped the naked of their clothing.
KJVverseText: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

IVverseText: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
KJVverseText: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

IVverseText: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honorable man dwelt in it.
KJVverseText: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honorable man dwelt in it.

IVverseText: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
KJVverseText: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

IVverseText: Therefore, snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee,
KJVverseText: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

IVverseText: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.
KJVverseText: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

IVverseText: Is not God in the height of heaven? And behold the height of the stars--how high they are!
KJVverseText: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

IVverseText: And thou sayest, How doth God know? Can he judge through the dark cloud?
KJVverseText: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

IVverseText: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
KJVverseText: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

IVverseText: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
KJVverseText: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

IVverseText: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood;
KJVverseText: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

IVverseText: Which said unto God, Depart from us. And what can the Almighty do for them?
KJVverseText: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

IVverseText: Yet he filled their houses with good things; but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
KJVverseText: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

IVverseText: The righteous see it and are glad; and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
KJVverseText: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

IVverseText: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
KJVverseText: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

IVverseText: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace; thereby good shall come unto thee.
KJVverseText: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

IVverseText: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
KJVverseText: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

IVverseText: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up; thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
KJVverseText: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

IVverseText: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
KJVverseText: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

IVverseText: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
KJVverseText: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defense, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

IVverseText: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
KJVverseText: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

IVverseText: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee; and thou shalt pay thy vows.
KJVverseText: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

IVverseText: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee; and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
KJVverseText: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

IVverseText: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
KJVverseText: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

IVverseText: He shall deliver the island of the innocent; and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
KJVverseText: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.

IVverseText: Then Job answered and said,
KJVverseText: Then Job answered and said,

IVverseText: Even to-day is my complaint bitter; my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
KJVverseText: Even today is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.

IVverseText: Oh, that I knew where I might find him! That I might come even to his seat!
KJVverseText: Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!

IVverseText: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
KJVverseText: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.

IVverseText: I would know the words which he would answer me and understand what he would say unto me.
KJVverseText: I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.

IVverseText: Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.
KJVverseText: Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.

IVverseText: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
KJVverseText: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.

IVverseText: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him;
KJVverseText: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:

IVverseText: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him; he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him;
KJVverseText: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him:

IVverseText: But he knoweth the way that I take; when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
KJVverseText: But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.

IVverseText: My foot hath held his steps; his way have I kept and not declined.
KJVverseText: My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.

IVverseText: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
KJVverseText: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.

IVverseText: But he is in one mind. And who can turn him? And what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.
KJVverseText: But he is in one mind, and who can turn him? and what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.

IVverseText: For he performeth the thing that is appointed for me; and many such things are with him.
KJVverseText: For he performeth the thing that is appointed for me: and many such things are with him.

IVverseText: Therefore am I troubled at his presence; when I consider, I am afraid of him.
KJVverseText: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.

IVverseText: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me,
KJVverseText: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:

IVverseText: Because I was not cut off before the darkness; neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.
KJVverseText: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.

IVverseText: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?
KJVverseText: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?

IVverseText: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks and feed thereof.
KJVverseText: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.

IVverseText: They drive away the ass of the fatherless; they take the widow's ox for a pledge.
KJVverseText: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow's ox for a pledge.

IVverseText: They turn the needy out of the way; the poor of the earth hide themselves together.
KJVverseText: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.

IVverseText: Behold, as wild asses in the desert go they forth to their work, rising betimes for a prey; the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.
KJVverseText: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.

IVverseText: They reap every one his corn in the field; and they gather the vintage of the wicked.
KJVverseText: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.

IVverseText: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.
KJVverseText: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.

IVverseText: They are wet with the showers of the mountains and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
KJVverseText: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.

IVverseText: They pluck the fatherless from the breast and take a pledge of the poor.
KJVverseText: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.

IVverseText: They cause him to go naked without clothing and they take away the sheaf from the hungry,
KJVverseText: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;

IVverseText: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
KJVverseText: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.

IVverseText: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out; yet God layeth not folly to them.
KJVverseText: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.

IVverseText: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof nor abide in the paths thereof.
KJVverseText: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.

IVverseText: The murderer, rising with the light, killeth the poor and needy and in the night is as a thief.
KJVverseText: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.

IVverseText: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me, and disguiseth his face.
KJVverseText: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.

IVverseText: In the dark they dig through houses which they had marked for themselves in the daytime; they know not the light.
KJVverseText: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.

IVverseText: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death; if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.
KJVverseText: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.

IVverseText: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth; he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.
KJVverseText: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.

IVverseText: Drought and heat consume the snow waters; so doth the grave those which have sinned.
KJVverseText: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned.

IVverseText: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
KJVverseText: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.

IVverseText: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not and doeth not good to the widow.
KJVverseText: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.

IVverseText: He draweth also the mighty with his power; he riseth up, and no man is sure of life,
KJVverseText: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.

IVverseText: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.
KJVverseText: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.

IVverseText: They are exalted for a little while but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.
KJVverseText: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.

IVverseText: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar and make my speech nothing worth?
KJVverseText: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?

IVverseText: Then answered Bildad, the Shuhite, and said,
KJVverseText: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

IVverseText: Dominion and fear are with him; he maketh peace in his high places.
KJVverseText: Dominion and fear are with him, he maketh peace in his high places.

IVverseText: Is there any number of his armies? And upon whom doth not his light arise?
KJVverseText: Is there any number of his armies? and upon whom doth not his light arise?

IVverseText: How then can man be justified with God? Or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
KJVverseText: How then can man be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?

IVverseText: Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; yea, the stars are not pure in his sight--
KJVverseText: Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; yea, the stars are not pure in his sight.

IVverseText: How much less man, that is a worm, and the son of man, which is a worm?
KJVverseText: How much less man, that is a worm? and the son of man, which is a worm?

IVverseText: But Job answered and said,
KJVverseText: But Job answered and said,

IVverseText: How hast thou helped him that is without power? How savest thou the arm that hath no strength?
KJVverseText: How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?

IVverseText: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? And how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
KJVverseText: How hast thou counseled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?

IVverseText: To whom hast thou uttered words? And whose spirit came from thee?
KJVverseText: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?

IVverseText: Dead things are formed from under the waters and the inhabitants thereof.
KJVverseText: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.

IVverseText: Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.
KJVverseText: Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.

IVverseText: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place and hangeth the earth upon nothing.
KJVverseText: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.

IVverseText: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
KJVverseText: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.

IVverseText: He holdeth back the face of his throne and spreadeth his cloud upon it.
KJVverseText: He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.

IVverseText: He hath compassed the waters with bounds until the day and night come to an end.
KJVverseText: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.

IVverseText: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
KJVverseText: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.

IVverseText: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.
KJVverseText: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.

IVverseText: By his Spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
KJVverseText: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.

IVverseText: Lo, these are parts of his ways. But how little a portion is heard of him? But the thunder of his power, who can understand?
KJVverseText: Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?

IVverseText: Moreover, Job continued his parable and said,
KJVverseText: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

IVverseText: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment, and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul,
KJVverseText: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;

IVverseText: All the while my breath is in me, and the Spirit of God is in my nostrils,
KJVverseText: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;

IVverseText: My lips shall not speak wickedness nor my tongue utter deceit.
KJVverseText: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

IVverseText: God forbid that I should justify you; till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
KJVverseText: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

IVverseText: My righteousness I hold fast and will not let it go; my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
KJVverseText: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

IVverseText: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
KJVverseText: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

IVverseText: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
KJVverseText: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

IVverseText: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
KJVverseText: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

IVverseText: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? Will he always call upon God?
KJVverseText: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?

IVverseText: I will teach you by the hand of God; that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
KJVverseText: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

IVverseText: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it. Why then are ye thus altogether vain?
KJVverseText: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

IVverseText: This is the portion of a wicked man with God and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
KJVverseText: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

IVverseText: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword; and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
KJVverseText: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

IVverseText: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death; and his widows shall not weep.
KJVverseText: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

IVverseText: Though he heap up silver as the dust and prepare raiment as the clay,
KJVverseText: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

IVverseText: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
KJVverseText: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

IVverseText: He buildeth his house as a moth and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
KJVverseText: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.

IVverseText: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered; he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
KJVverseText: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

IVverseText: Terrors take hold on him as waters; a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
KJVverseText: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

IVverseText: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth, and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
KJVverseText: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

IVverseText: For God shall cast upon him and not spare; he would fain flee out of his hand.
KJVverseText: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

IVverseText: Men shall clap their hands at him and shall hiss him out of his place.
KJVverseText: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.

IVverseText: Surely there is a vein for the silver and a place for gold where they fine it.
KJVverseText: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.

IVverseText: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.
KJVverseText: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.

IVverseText: He setteth an end to darkness and searcheth out all perfection--the stones of darkness and the shadow of death.
KJVverseText: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.

IVverseText: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant, even the waters forgotten of the foot; they are dried up; they are gone away from men.
KJVverseText: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.

IVverseText: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread; and under it is turned up as it were fire.
KJVverseText: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.

IVverseText: The stones of it are the place of sapphires; and it hath dust of gold.
KJVverseText: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.

IVverseText: There is a path which no fowl knoweth and which the vulture's eye hath not seen;
KJVverseText: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture's eye hath not seen:

IVverseText: The lion's whelps have not trodden it nor the fierce lion passed by it.
KJVverseText: The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.

IVverseText: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.
KJVverseText: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.

IVverseText: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.
KJVverseText: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.

IVverseText: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
KJVverseText: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.

IVverseText: But where shall wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
KJVverseText: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?

IVverseText: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.
KJVverseText: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

IVverseText: The depth saith, It is not in me. And the sea saith, It is not with me.
KJVverseText: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.

IVverseText: It cannot be gotten for gold; neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
KJVverseText: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

IVverseText: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
KJVverseText: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

IVverseText: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it; and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
KJVverseText: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.

IVverseText: No mention shall be made of coral or of pearls; for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
KJVverseText: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.

IVverseText: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it; neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
KJVverseText: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

IVverseText: Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding,
KJVverseText: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?

IVverseText: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living and kept close from the fowls of the air?
KJVverseText: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

IVverseText: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.
KJVverseText: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.

IVverseText: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.
KJVverseText: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.

IVverseText: For he looketh to the ends of the earth and seeth under the whole heaven,
KJVverseText: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;

IVverseText: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.
KJVverseText: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

IVverseText: When he made a decree for the rain and a way for the lightning of the thunder,
KJVverseText: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:

IVverseText: Then did he see it and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
KJVverseText: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.

IVverseText: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord--that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
KJVverseText: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the LORD, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.

IVverseText: Moreover, Job continued his parable and said,
KJVverseText: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

IVverseText: Oh, that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
KJVverseText: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;

IVverseText: When his candle shined upon my head and when by his light I walked through darkness;
KJVverseText: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;

IVverseText: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;
KJVverseText: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;

IVverseText: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
KJVverseText: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;

IVverseText: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
KJVverseText: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;

IVverseText: When I went out to the gate through the city; when I prepared my seat in the street!
KJVverseText: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!

IVverseText: The young men saw me and hid themselves; and the aged arose and stood up.
KJVverseText: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.

IVverseText: The princes refrained talking and laid their hand on their mouth.
KJVverseText: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

IVverseText: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
KJVverseText: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

IVverseText: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me,
KJVverseText: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

IVverseText: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.
KJVverseText: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.

IVverseText: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me; and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.
KJVverseText: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.

IVverseText: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me; my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.
KJVverseText: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.

IVverseText: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.
KJVverseText: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

IVverseText: I was a father to the poor; and the cause which I knew not I searched out.
KJVverseText: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.

IVverseText: And I brake the jaws of the wicked and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
KJVverseText: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.

IVverseText: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.
KJVverseText: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.

IVverseText: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
KJVverseText: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.

IVverseText: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
KJVverseText: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.

IVverseText: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
KJVverseText: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.

IVverseText: After my words, they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
KJVverseText: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.

IVverseText: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
KJVverseText: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

IVverseText: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
KJVverseText: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

IVverseText: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
KJVverseText: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.

IVverseText: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.
KJVverseText: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

IVverseText: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?
KJVverseText: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

IVverseText: For want and famine they were solitary, fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste,
KJVverseText: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

IVverseText: Who cut up mallows by the bushes and juniper roots for their meat.
KJVverseText: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

IVverseText: They were driven forth from among men (they cried after them as after a thief),
KJVverseText: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)

IVverseText: To dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
KJVverseText: To dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.

IVverseText: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
KJVverseText: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

IVverseText: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men; they were viler than the earth.
KJVverseText: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

IVverseText: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.
KJVverseText: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

IVverseText: They abhor me; they flee far from me and spare not to spit in my face.
KJVverseText: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

IVverseText: Because he hath loosed my cord and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
KJVverseText: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

IVverseText: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.
KJVverseText: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

IVverseText: They mar my path; they set forward my calamity; they have no helper.
KJVverseText: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

IVverseText: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters; in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.
KJVverseText: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.

IVverseText: Terrors are turned upon me; they pursue my soul as the wind; and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
KJVverseText: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.

IVverseText: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
KJVverseText: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

IVverseText: My bones are pierced in me in the night season; and my sinews take no rest.
KJVverseText: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

IVverseText: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed; it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
KJVverseText: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

IVverseText: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
KJVverseText: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

IVverseText: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me; I stand up, and thou regardest me not.
KJVverseText: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.

IVverseText: Thou art become cruel to me; with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
KJVverseText: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.

IVverseText: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it and dissolvest my substance.
KJVverseText: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.

IVverseText: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death and to the house appointed for all living.
KJVverseText: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

IVverseText: Howbeit, he will not stretch out his hand to the grave though they cry in his destruction.
KJVverseText: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

IVverseText: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? Was not my soul grieved for the poor?
KJVverseText: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?

IVverseText: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me; and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
KJVverseText: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

IVverseText: My bowels boiled and rested not; the days of affliction prevented me.
KJVverseText: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

IVverseText: I went mourning without the sun; I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.
KJVverseText: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

IVverseText: I am a brother to dragons and a companion to owls.
KJVverseText: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

IVverseText: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
KJVverseText: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

IVverseText: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
KJVverseText: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.

IVverseText: I made a covenant with mine eyes. Why then should I think upon a maid?
KJVverseText: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

IVverseText: For what portion of God is there from above? And what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
KJVverseText: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

IVverseText: Is not destruction to the wicked and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
KJVverseText: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

IVverseText: Doth not he see my ways and count all my steps?
KJVverseText: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

IVverseText: If I have walked with vanity or if my foot hath hasted to deceit,
KJVverseText: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

IVverseText: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.
KJVverseText: Let me be weighed in an even balance that God may know mine integrity.

IVverseText: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands,
KJVverseText: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

IVverseText: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
KJVverseText: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

IVverseText: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman or if I have laid wait at my neighbor's door,
KJVverseText: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbor's door;

IVverseText: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.
KJVverseText: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

IVverseText: For this is a heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
KJVverseText: For this is a heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

IVverseText: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction and would root out all mine increase.
KJVverseText: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

IVverseText: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant when they contended with me,
KJVverseText: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

IVverseText: What then shall I do when God riseth up? And when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
KJVverseText: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

IVverseText: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? And did not one fashion us in the womb?
KJVverseText: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

IVverseText: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,
KJVverseText: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

IVverseText: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof,
KJVverseText: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

IVverseText: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb),
KJVverseText: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)

IVverseText: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering,
KJVverseText: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

IVverseText: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep,
KJVverseText: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

IVverseText: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless when I saw my help in the gate,
KJVverseText: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

IVverseText: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade and mine arm be broken from the bone.
KJVverseText: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.

IVverseText: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
KJVverseText: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

IVverseText: If I have made gold my hope or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence,
KJVverseText: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

IVverseText: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great and because mine hand had gotten much,
KJVverseText: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

IVverseText: If I beheld the sun when it shined or the moon walking in brightness,
KJVverseText: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

IVverseText: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand,
KJVverseText: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:

IVverseText: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge; for I should have denied the God that is above.
KJVverseText: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

IVverseText: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me or lifted up myself when evil found him;
KJVverseText: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

IVverseText: (Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul);
KJVverseText: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

IVverseText: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh, that we had of his flesh! We cannot be satisfied;
KJVverseText: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

IVverseText: The stranger did not lodge in the street, but I opened my doors to the traveller;
KJVverseText: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveler.

IVverseText: If I covered my transgressions, as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom;
KJVverseText: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:

IVverseText: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence and went not out of the door?
KJVverseText: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

IVverseText: Oh, that one would hear me! Behold, my desire is that the Almighty would answer me and that mine adversary had written a book.
KJVverseText: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.

IVverseText: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder and bind it as a crown to me.
KJVverseText: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

IVverseText: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.
KJVverseText: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

IVverseText: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain,
KJVverseText: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

IVverseText: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life,
KJVverseText: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

IVverseText: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
KJVverseText: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.

IVverseText: So these three men ceased to answer Job because he was righteous in his own eyes.
KJVverseText: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

IVverseText: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu, the son of Barachel, the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram; against Job was his wrath kindled because he justified himself rather than God.
KJVverseText: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

IVverseText: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled because they had found no answer and yet had condemned Job.
KJVverseText: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

IVverseText: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken because they were elder than he.
KJVverseText: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.

IVverseText: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
KJVverseText: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

IVverseText: And Elihu, the son of Barachel, the Buzite, answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore, I was afraid and durst not show you mine opinion.
KJVverseText: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not show you mine opinion.

IVverseText: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
KJVverseText: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

IVverseText: But there is a spirit in man; and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
KJVverseText: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

IVverseText: Great men are not always wise; neither do the aged understand judgment.
KJVverseText: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

IVverseText: Therefore, I said, Hearken to me; I also will show mine opinion.
KJVverseText: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will show mine opinion.

IVverseText: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons whilst ye searched out what to say.
KJVverseText: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

IVverseText: Yea, I attended unto you; and behold, there was none of you that convinced Job or that answered his words,
KJVverseText: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:

IVverseText: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom; God thrusteth him down, not man.
KJVverseText: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

IVverseText: Now he hath not directed his words against me; neither will I answer him with your speeches.
KJVverseText: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.

IVverseText: They were amazed; they answered no more; they left off speaking.
KJVverseText: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.

IVverseText: When I had waited (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more),
KJVverseText: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)

IVverseText: I said, I will answer also my part; I also will show mine opinion.
KJVverseText: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will show mine opinion.

IVverseText: For I am full of matter; the spirit within me constraineth me.
KJVverseText: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

IVverseText: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
KJVverseText: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

IVverseText: I will speak, that I may be refreshed; I will open my lips and answer.
KJVverseText: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

IVverseText: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person; neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
KJVverseText: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
